conclusion: Use principles of refraction and relationship between refractive indices of light bulbs and water
Identify refractive indices: \( n_1 \) for red light, \( n_2 \) for yellow light
Angles of incidence and refraction are equal, ratio of distances from light bulb to water surface is the same
Ratio of distances from light bulb to water surface is \( \frac{d_1}{d_2} = \frac{n_2}{n_1} \)
Area of light-emitting area is proportional to square of distance from light bulb to water surface
Area of light-emitting area for red light is \( \left(\frac{n_2}{n_1}\right)^2 \times \text{Area}_{\text{yellow}} \)
Area of light-emitting area for red light is \( \text{Area}_{\text{red}} = \text{Area}_{\text{yellow}} \)
Area of light-emitting area of a light bulb is the same for both red and yellow light
